intro: Amsinckia arizonica, commonly known as the Arizona fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and disturbed soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. The flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, are yellow to orange in color and attract various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
